metadata.title: CVE-2015-2331 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the _zip_cdir_new function in zip_dirent.c in libzip0.11.2 and earlier, as used in the ZIP extension in PHP before 5.4.39,5.5.x before 5.5.23, and 5.6.x before 5.6.7 and other products, allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) orpossibly execute arbitrary code via a ZIP archive that contains manyentries, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2331` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7

No subscription required

libzip2 - 0.10.1-1.2
zipcmp - 0.10.1-1.2
zipmerge - 0.10.1-1.2
ziptorrent - 0.10.1-1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7').
libzip package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.10.1-1.2').
